Greetings to Iranian President 
    Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Iranian President Seyed Mohammad Khatami on the occasion of the Iranian New Year.
 Expressing belief that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Iran would grow stronger in different fields, the message sincerely wished the president good health and happiness and the government and people of Iran prosperity and well-being.

Greetings to Namibian Foreign Minister 
    Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to his Namibian counterpart Marco Hausiku on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries.
 The message expressed satisfaction over the fact that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries have favorably developed despite the complicated international situation over the last 15 years and reiterated the will to boost the bilateral relations in different fields in the mutual interests.    
 It sincerely wished the foreign minister good health and greater success in his work.

Russians Visit Jongbaek Church under Construction
    Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Andrei Karlov and staff members of the Russian embassy here visited Jongbaek Church under construction in Thongil Street, Pyongyang, on Friday to plant trees there.
 After being briefed on the progress of its construction, the visitors planted scores of white birches representing the DPRK-Russia friendship around the church, together with Chairman of the Korean Orthodox Church Committee Ho Il Jin and officials concerned.    
 We are happy to have planted trees around Jongbaek Church under construction, the ambassador said, adding that the church will be a symbol of friendship between the peoples of the two countries.
